H2.text: when was the last wolf pack killed in yellowstone. 1880

H3.text: when was the last wolf pack killed in yellowstone. 1926

A4.text: Further exterminations continued until the National Park Service ended the practice in 1935.

A5.text: Park Service hunters carried out these orders, and by 1926 they had killed 136 wolves.

A6.text: The last official killing of wolves in the park took place in 1926 when two pups found near Soda Butte Creek were killed by park rangers.

A7.text: The last wolves were killed in Yellowstone in 1926.
